ENG_GB: Please say, for each of the following, how important it is in your life.
When you get together with your friends, would you say you discuss political matters frequently, occasionally or never?
am now going to read out some statements about the environment.
For each one read out, can you tell me whether you agree strongly, agree, disagree or strongly disagree?
Read out each statement and code an answer for each
would give part of my income if I were certain that the money would be used to prevent environmental pollution
would agree to an increase in taxes if the extra money is used to prevent environmental pollution
The Government has to reduce environmental pollution but it should not cost me any money
Thinking of the environment and taking all things together, would you say you are ...
Please look carefully at the following list of voluntary organisations and activities and say ... which, if any, do you belong to?
Social welfare services for elderly, handicapped or deprived people
Education, arts, music or cultural activities
Local community action on issues like poverty, employment, housing, racial equality
Third world development or human rights
Conservation, the environment, ecology, animal rights
Youth work (e.g., scouts, guides, youth clubs etc.)
Please look carefully at the following list of voluntary organisations and activities and say ... which, if any, are you currently doing unpaid voluntary work for?
Social welfare services for elderly, handicapped or deprived people
Education, arts, music or cultural activities
Local community action on issues like poverty, employment, housing, racial equality
Third world development or human rights
Conservation, the environment, ecology, animal rights
Youth work (e.g., scouts, guides, youth clubs etc.)
I'm going to ask how often you do certain things.
Giving an answer from this card please tell me how often you do each.
Interviewer: Code 'Not applicable' when respondent is not involved in the activity at all
Spend time with colleagues from work or your profession outside the workplace
Spend time with people at your church, mosque or synagogue
Spend time with people in clubs and voluntary associations (sport, culture, communal)
On this list are various groups of people.
Could you please tell me any that you would not, generally speaking, like to have as neighbours?
Generally speaking, would you say that most people can be trusted or that you can't be too careful in dealing with people?
Some people feel they have completely free choice and control over their lives, and other people feel that what they do has no real effect on what happens to them.
Please use the scale to indicate how much freedom of choice and control you feel you have over the way your life turns out?
Read out 1=None at all, 10=A great deal
All things considered, how satisfied are you with your life as a whole these days?
Please use this card to help with your answer.
Why are there people in this country who live in need?
Which one reason do you consider to be most important?
because of laziness and lack of willpower
because of injustice in our society
it's an inevitable part of modern progress
And one reason you consider to be the second most important?
because of laziness and lack of willpower
because of injustice in our society
it's an inevitable part of modern progress
Here are some aspects of a job that people say are important.
Please look at them and tell me which ones you personally think are important in a job?
job respected by people in general
job in which you feel you can achieve something
To have time off at the weekends
Are you yourself employed or not?
Overall, how satisfied or dissatisfied are you with your job?
How free are you to make decisions in your job?
Please use this card to indicate how much decision-making freedom you feel you have.
Read out 1=None at all, 10=A great deal
And how satisfied or dissatisfied are you with your job security?
Please use this card to indicate how satisfied or dissatisfied you are.
Using this card how much do you agree or disagree with the following statements?
To fully develop your talents, you need to have a job
People who can't find paid jobs should be required to do community work
It is humiliating to receive money without having to work for it
People who don't work turn lazy
Work is a duty towards society
People should not have to work if they don't want to
Work should always come first, even if it means less spare time
Imagine two secretaries, of the same age, doing practically the same job.
One finds out that the other earns 50 a week more than she does.
The better paid secretary, however, is quicker, more efficient and more reliable at her job.
In your opinion is it fair or not fair that one secretary is paid more than the other?
People have different ideas about following instruction at work.
Some say that one should follow instructions of one's superiors even when one does not fully agree with them.
Others say that one should follow one's superior's instructions only when one is convinced that they are right.
Which of these two opinions do you agree with?
Do you agree or disagree with the following statements?
When jobs are scarce, employers should give priority to British people over immigrants
When jobs are scarce, men have more right to a job than women
How often, if at all, do you think about the meaning and purpose of life?
Read out A B C D - in reverse order for alternate contacts
Here are two statements which people sometimes make when discussing good and evil.
Which one comes closest to your own point of view?
A: There are absolutely clear guidelines about what is good and evil.
These always apply to everyone, whatever the circumstances.
B: There can never be absolutely clear guidelines about what is good and evil.
What is good and evil depends entirely upon the circumstances at the time.
What religious denomination do you consider yourself to be, whether you currently practise that religion or not?
Do you or did you ever practise any religion?
That is, attend religious ceremonies or meetings on a regular basis?
Yes  Now or in the past
(if more than one, the most recent)
Apart from weddings, funerals and christenings, about how often do you attend religious services these days?
Apart from weddings, funerals and christenings, about how often did you attend religious services when you were 12 years old?
Do you personally think it is important to hold a religious service for any of the following events?
Independently of whether you go to church or not, would you say you are ...
Read out A B C reversing order between respondents
Generally speaking, do you think that your church is/the churches are giving, in this country, adequate answers to ...
Read out and code one answer for each
For those belonging to a church or a religious community, ask YOUR church/ religious community For those not belonging to a church or religious community ask: THE churches
The moral problems and needs of the individual
The social problems facing our country today
Which, if any, of the following do you believe in?
Read out and code one answer for each
Which of these statements comes closest to your beliefs?
there is some sort of spirit or life force
don't really know what to think
don't really think there is any sort of spirit, God or life force
And how important is God in your life?
Read out: 1=Not at all important, 10=Very important
Do you find that you get comfort and strength from religion or not?
Do you take some moments of prayer, meditation or contemplation or something like that?
How often do you pray to God outside of religious services?
Do you have a lucky charm such as a mascot or a talisman?
Do you believe that a lucky charm such as a mascot or a talisman can protect or help you?
How much do you agree or disagree with each of the following:
Politicians who do not believe in God are unfit for public office
Religious leaders should not influence how people vote in elections
It would be better for Britain if more people with strong religious beliefs held public office
Religious leaders should not influence government decisions
If a nurse were asked to help perform a legal abortion, she should be allowed to refuse on religious grounds
Here is a list of things which some people think make for a successful marriage.
Please tell me from this card how important or unimportant each is in your opinion for a successful marriage?
Being of the same social background
Being willing to discuss the problems that come up between husband and wife
Spending as much time together as possible
Talking a lot about mutual interests
Being involved in the local community
Being from the same ethnic background
If someone says a child needs a home with both a father and a mother to grow up happily, would you tend to agree or disagree?
Do you think that a woman has to have children in order to be fulfilled?
Do you agree or disagree with the following statement?
If a woman wants to have a child as a single parent, but she doesn't want to have a stable relationship with a man, do you approve or disapprove?
From this card, how much do you agree or disagree with the following statements?
man has to have children in order to be fulfilled
marriage or a long-term stable relationship is necessary to be happy
People talk about the changing roles of men and women today.
For each of the following statements I read out, can you tell me how much you agree with each.
Please use the responses on this card.
working mother can establish just as warm and secure a relationship with her children as a mother who does not work
pre-school child is likely to suffer if his or her mother works
job is alright but what most women really want is a home and children
Being a housewife is just as fulfilling as working for pay
Having a job is the best way for a woman to be an independent person
Both the husband and wife should contribute to household income
In general, fathers are as well suited to look after their children as mothers
Men are less able to handle emotions in relationships than women
Which of these two statements do you tend to agree with?

A: Regardless of what the qualities and faults of ones parents are, one must always love and respect them  B: One does not have the duty to respect and love parents who have not earned it by their behaviour and attitudes
tend to agree with statement A
tend to agree with statement B
Which of these statements best describes your views about parents, responsibilities to their children?
parents' duty is to do their best for their children even at the expense of their own well-being
parents have a life of their own and should not be asked to sacrifice their own well-being for the sake of their children
Here is a list of qualities which children can be encouraged to learn at home.
Which, if any, do you consider to be especially important?
Tolerance and respect for other people
Do you approve or disapprove of abortion under the following circumstances?
Where the woman is not married
Where a married couple does not want to have any more children
How interested would you say you are in politics?
Now I'd like you to look at this card.

I'm going to read out some different forms of political action that people can take, and I'd like you to tell me, for each one, whether you have actually done any of these things, whether you might do it or would never, under any circumstances, do it.
Which of these two statements comes closest to your own opinion?
A: I find that both freedom and equality are important.

But if I were to choose one or the other, I would consider personal freedom more important, that is, everyone can live in freedom and develop without hinderance B: Certainly both freedom and equality are important.
But if I were to choose one or the other, I would consider equality more important, that is, that nobody is underprivileged and that social class differences are not so strong
In political matters, people talk of 'the left' and the 'the right'.
How would you place your views on this scale, generally speaking?
Now I'd like you to tell me your views on various issues.
How would you place your views on this scale?
Read out: 1= and 10= as shown below FOR EACH QUESTION
Individuals should take more responsibility for providing for themselves
The state should take more responsibility to ensure that everyone is provided for
Now I'd like you to tell me your views on various issues.
How would you place your views on this scale?
Read out 1= and 10= as shown below FOR EACH QUESTION
People who are unemployed should have to take any job available or lose their unemployment benefits
People who are unemployed should have the right to refuse a job they do not want
Now I'd like you to tell me your views on various issues.
How would you place your views on this scale?
Read out 1= and 10= as shown below FOR EACH QUESTION
It stimulates people to work hard and develop new ideas
Competition is harmful, it brings out the worst in people
Now I'd like you to tell me your views on various issues.
How would you place your views on this scale?
Read out 1= and 10= as shown below FOR EACH QUESTION
The state should give more freedom to firms
The state should control firms more effectively
Now I'd like you to tell me your views on various issues.
How would you place your views on this scale?
Read out 1= and 10= as shown below FOR EACH QUESTION
One should be cautious about making major changes in life
You will never achieve much unless you act boldly
Now I'd like you to tell me your views on various issues.
How would you place your views on this scale?
Read out 1= and 10= as shown below FOR EACH QUESTION
Charities should look after the poor
The state should look after the poor
Now I'd like you to tell me your views on various issues.
How would you place your views on this scale?
Read out 1= and 10= as shown below FOR EACH QUESTION
Incomes should be made more equal
There should be greater incentives for individual effort
Now I'd like you to tell me your views on various issues.
How would you place your views on this scale?
Read out 1= and 10= as shown below FOR EACH QUESTION
Private ownership of business and industry should be increased
Government ownership of business and industry should be increased
Now I'd like you to tell me your views on various issues.
How would you place your views on this scale?
Read out 1= and 10= as shown below FOR EACH QUESTION
Each individual should be responsible for arranging his or her own pension
The state should be responsible for everyone's pension
Now I'd like you to tell me your views on various issues.
How would you place your views on this scale?
Read out 1= and 10= as shown below FOR EACH QUESTION
Each individual should be responsible for arranging his or her own housing
The state should be responsible for everyone's housing
There is a lot of talk these days about what the aims of this country should be for the next ten years.
On this card are listed some of the goals which different people would give top priority.
If you had to choose, which of the things on this card would you say is most important?
GB: maintaining order in the no answertion
GB: giving people more say in important government decisions
GB: improving the standard of living
And which would be the next most important?
GB: maintain order in no answertion
GB: more say important government decisions
GB: improving the standard of living
am going to read a list of various changes in our way of life that might take place in the near future.
Please tell me for each one, if it were to happen whether you think it would be a good thing, a bad thing, or don't you mind?
Less emphasis on money and material possessions
Make work less central in our lives
In the long run, do you think the scientific advances we are making will help or harm mankind?
Please look at this card and tell me, for each item I read out, how much confidence you have in them...
On the whole are you very satisfied, rather satisfied, not very satisfied or not at all satisfied with the way democracy is developing in our country?
People have different views about the system for governing this country.
Here is a scale for rating how well things are going
Where on this scale would you put the political system as it was 10 years ago?
I'm going to describe various types of political systems and ask what you think about each as a way of governing this country.
Please give me and answer from this card to reflect your opinion regarding whether each would be a good or a bad way of governing this country
Having a strong leader who does not have to bother with parliament and elections
Having experts, not government, make decisions according to what they think is best for the country
Having the army rule the country
I'm going to read off some things that people sometimes say about a democratic political system.
How much do you agree or disagree with each statement?
Democracy may have problems but it's better than any other form of government
In democracy, the economic system runs badly
Democracies are indecisive and have too much squabbling
Democracies aren't good at maintaining order
How much respect is there for individual human rights nowadays (in our country)?
a lot of respect for individual human rights
Please tell me for each of the following statements whether you think it can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between, using this card.
(Read out statements reversing order for alternate contacts) Remind respondent that 1=Can never be justified and 10=Can always be justified and to always consider the scale in between.
Claiming state benefits which you are not entitled to
Cheating on tax if you have the chance
Taking and driving away a car belonging to someone else (joyriding)
Taking the drug marijuana or hashish
Someone accepting a bribe in the course of their duties
Euthanasia (terminating the life of the incurably sick)
Throwing away litter in a public place
Driving under the influence of alcohol
Paying cash for services to avoid taxes
Speeding over the limit in built-up areas
Avoiding a fare on public transport
Sex under the legal age of consent

Claiming state benefits to which they are not entitled
Cheating on tax if they have the chance
Paying cash for services to avoid taxes
Taking the drug marijuana or hash
Throwing away litter in a public place
Speeding over the limit in built-up areas
Driving under the influence of alcohol
Avoiding a fare on public transport
Accepting a bribe in the course of their duties

locality or town where you live
region of country where you live
locality or town where you live
region of country where you live

locality or town where you live
region of country where you live
Are you a citizen of Britain?
How proud are you to be a British citizen?

do not trust them very much
do not trust them at all
If there was a general election tomorrow, which party would you vote for?
And which party appeals to you most?
How about people from less developed countries coming here to work.
Which one of the following do you think the government should do?
let anyone come who wants to
let people come as long as there are jobs available
put strict limits on the number of foreigners who can come here
prohibit people coming here from other countries

A: For the greater good of society it is better if immigrants maintain their distinct customs and traditions

In order to be considered "just", what should a society provide?

This time I would like a score our of 5 where 1 = very important and 5 = not important at all.
Eliminating big inequalities in income between citizens
Guaranteeing that basic needs are met for all, in terms of food, housing, clothes, education, health
Giving young people equal opportunity to pursue their education irrespective of family income
How often do you follow politics in the news on television or on the radio or in the daily papers?
Can you tell me your opinion on each of the following statements?
If someone has information that may help justice be done, generally he or she  should give it to authorities
People should stick to their own affairs and not show too much interest in what others say or do

sick and disabled people in your country

ENG_GB: We would like to ask you about donating money to charitable causes.
For example, some people give money to help the poor, others to cancer research, for hunger relief in Africa, or for the arts and culture.
Listed on this card are examples of the areas in which people contribute money.
Did you give money to any of these in 1999?
Of the areas mentioned, how much would you say you have contributed so far this year?
Ask for each coded Yes at Q83a_
There are many reasons why people can't give to charity.
Do you think that you give more, less or about the same to charity that other people in Britain?
Do you play the National Lottery frequently, sometimes or not at all?
Compared to two years ago, would you say that you play the lottery more often, less, or about the same?
In your opinion, do you think you are more or less involved in community life and activities than other people?
Generally speaking, do you think that Britain's membership of the European Union is ...?
neither a good nor a bad thing
There are two ways of looking at the future of the European Union: Some people think that the EU should have the final say in decisions in some important areas.
Others think that the individual Governments of member states should have the final say.
Which comes closest to your view?
National Governments to have the final say
On the whole, do you think that Britain's interests are better served by ...?
closer links with the European Union
